content: The "Dam Safety and Security Act of 2002" amends the National Dam Safety Program Act. It establishes an Interagency Committee on Dam Safety. SEC. 2 amends Section 7(b) by focusing on Federal programs and coordination among Federal agencies for dam safety. Section 8(a)(3) is amended to replace "implementation plan" with "strategic plan" and update references to subsections. Section 8(b) now requires the Director to prepare a strategic plan to enhance dam safety in the US. The Director is required to prepare a strategic plan to improve dam safety in the United States, establish goals, priorities, and cooperation with interested governmental entities in all States. Amendments are made to Section 8(b) and Section 8(c) to outline these duties and objectives.
